general.headline: Senior Government Lawyer  at Australian Government Department of Jobs and Small Business
general.company: Australian Government Department of Jobs and Small Business
general.description:
I am a Victorian qualified solicitor with almost 5 years post qualification experience and an accredited mediator under the National Mediation Accreditation System.  My first 4.5 years of practice were spent at a leading boutique firm in Perth, followed by Western Australia’s largest independent law firm, Jackson McDonald and, subsequently, DLA Piper Australia (Melbourne).

My practice has been commercial litigation and dispute resolution in a range of areas including complex contractual disputes, construction disputes, franchising disputes, cross-jurisdictional disputes, intellectual property disputes, insolvency litigation and related litigation.  In the dispute resolution sphere, I attained my national accreditation as a mediator in September 2017.

I have worked for a large variety of clients, including major listed companies, high net worth individuals, national and foreign corporations, institutional banking clients, corporate advisory firms and government bodies. 

Prior to moving to Melbourne in January 2018, I appeared regularly as counsel in the Supreme Court of Western Australia, Federal Court of Australia and Court of Appeal in interlocutory and final hearings and have acted as instructing solicitor on many occasions. I have strong advocacy skills and also have experience assisting in international arbitrations, mediations (both court-ordered and private) and private negotiations.

Outside of work, I am a fitness and coffee enthusiast and enjoy boxing, reformer Pilates and food photography.

general.headline: Solicitor at Street Law Centre WA
general.description:
I began practice with Gibson and Gibson Lawyers as a Graduate Lawyer in the Litigation team in February 2013.

In August 2013, Gibson's merged with Slater & Gordon and I became part of  the Industrial and Employment Law Team. I worked predominantly on employment law matters.

I was admitted to Legal Practice on 7 November 2013 in the Supreme Court of Western Australia and soon after, to the High Court of Australia.

I have been a co-opted Committee Member of the Women Lawyer's Association of WA. 

In January 2015, I began employment with Bill Meredith as a Lawyer. I will predominantly be working on family law matters.

In July 2015, I began work at The Humanitarian Group as a lawyer and migration agent. I have predominantly practiced law with and for CALD women family who experience violence as temporary residents. This flows into other areas of practice: administrative law, criminal law and family law with other refugees and migrants in the Perth community.

Unfortunately, due to funding cuts, my time at The Humanitarian Group has come to an end. 

In October 2017, I secured a position with the Street Law Centre to work with one of the most vulnerable groups in our community. I will also be part of the Safe as Houses project aiming to prevent homelessness for people experiencing family violence. My areas of practice will be criminal and civil law.

general.description:
Janie has gained experience in various teams at Cullen Macleod since February 2017 and was admitted as a lawyer in November 2017.  Janie's experience spans Liquor Licensing, Wills and Estates, and Litigation.  

Prior to graduating, Janie completed clerkships at Cullen Macleod, HopgoodGanim Lawyers, Edith Cowan University, and John Toohey Chambers.  Whilst studying, Janie completed practical units with Northern Suburbs Community Legal Centre and the Perth based Innocence Project at Edith Cowan University.  Janie has an interest in domestic violence and completed an honours paper on this topic for her degree in 2016.

Janie also has proven Project Management, Team Leadership and Workshop Facilitation skills.  Prior to completing her LLB, Janie had a successful IT career that spanned 15 years and various locations including London, Perth, the Western Australian Wheatbelt and Pilbara regions, Barrow Island, Thevenard Island and Papua New Guinea.  Her most recent roles in IT were as an Infrastructure Project Manager predominantly in the Resources sector.  

Janie is a member of WiTWA and serves on a sub-committee.  Janie is keen to see how law and technology can combine to create better outcomes for legal clients, legal firms and legal professionals.

I have over 15 years’ experience acting for government, university and private clients both in Australia and internationally, on the full spectrum of property, infrastructure and resource projects. general.headline: State Prosecutor
general.company: The Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions for Western Australia

jobs.companyName: The Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions for Western Australia
jobs.description:
The Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (ODPP) is the independent prosecuting authority for the State of Western Australia, responsible for the prosecution of all serious offences committed against State criminal law.

Since January 2012 I have operated within one of the ODPP’s Trial Teams, managing a case load of indictable offences, and regularly appearing in the Supreme Court and District Court as trial counsel. I am also part of the team responsible for the prosecution of serious offences committed in the Kimberley region of Western Australia, requiring regular circuit work in Broome, Kununurra and Derby. From May 2011 until January 2012, I was seconded to the Magistrates Court Team, where I appeared as trial counsel on behalf of the State in complex summary hearings.

jobs.companyName: International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia
jobs.description:
The International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) is a United Nations court of law dealing with war crimes that took place during the conflicts in the Balkans in the 1990’s. The Tribunal has laid the foundations for what is now the accepted norm for conflict resolution and post-conflict development across the globe, specifically that leaders suspected of mass crimes will face justice. 

The Tribunal is based in The Hague, the Netherlands, with regional offices in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Kosovo and Serbia.

During a sabbatical from Australia, I worked at the ICTY and assisted on the final stages of the prosecution of General Ratko Mladić, the highest ranking military prosecution in the ICTY's history.
Tutored penultimate and final year law students in Evidence.

The Office of the Commonwealth Director of Public Prosecutions (CDPP) is an independent prosecution service established by Parliament to prosecute alleged offences against Commonwealth law. The organisation aims to provide an effective, ethical, high quality and independent criminal prosecution service for Australia in accordance with the Prosecution Policy of the Commonwealth.

As a lawyer within the General Prosecutions Branch, my work involved a variety of federal prosecutions including social security, identity fraud, narcotics, counterfeit currency, copyright and importation of child pornography. I appeared as counsel in summary hearings in the Magistrates Court and for the Crown at District Court sentences and trials. 

In November 2009 I was appointed case officer for the prosecution of the largest seizure of MDMA in Western Australia, which included acting as instructing solicitor in the 7-week Supreme Court trial of two of the co-offenders, both of whom were ultimately convicted and sentenced to significant terms of imprisonment.

Culshaw Miller Lawyers (formerly Marks & Sands) is a full service law firm in Perth, Western Australia practicing in areas such as, Family Law, Criminal Law, Wills and Estate Planning, Conveyancing, Property Law, Commercial Legal Matters, Litigation and Dispute Resolution, Employment, Contracts and Workplace Matters.

I was articled to the Partner of the Family Law Section (an Accredited Specialist) and given a considerable degree of independence. I was responsible for the day-to-day conduct of a number of family law matters, as well as some civil litigation and administration/guardianship files. 

After admission to practice in April 2008, my work involved a high level of client interaction, frequent court appearances, the instruction of counsel, as well as the drafting of legal advice, correspondence and court documents.

general.headline: Director - HBR Family Lawyers
general.description:
Lance Burra-Robinson is a highly experienced children’s and family lawyer, and the founder and Director of HBR Family Lawyers in Perth, Western Australia.

As a trusted legal adviser and representative for children and families, Lance is passionate about helping his clients resolve disputes amicably, while providing a fair, transparent and affordable service.

A graduate of the University of WA with degrees in Law and Arts, Lance was admitted to practice in the Supreme Court of WA in 2008, and in the High Court of Australia in 2009. As a qualified independent children’s lawyer, Lance honed his skills with some of Perth’s leading family law firms and has represented clients in the Children’s Court, the Family Court of WA and the Magistrates Court. He also participates on the Legal Aid WA specialist panels for Alternate Dispute Resolution, Children’s Court matters and General Family Law matters.

Lance established HBR Family Lawyers in 2016 to provide clients with a quality and cost-effective legal advisory and representation service that is focused on swiftly resolving matters through mediation and alternative dispute resolution as a preferred alternative to litigation. 

He specialises in all areas of family law including divorce, de facto relationships, property settlement, children’s issues, relocation of children, consent orders, adoption, mediation, enforcement of orders, binding financial agreements, injunctions and restraining orders, and spousal and partner maintenance.

With his personal approach and sympathetic understanding of the sensitive and stressful nature of family court proceedings, Lance informs and supports his clients throughout the dispute resolution process, negotiating  settlements out of court wherever possible, to ensure the best outcomes can be achieved for them in a timely manner, and without significant cost.

allSkills: Legal Advice, Dispute Resolution, Litigation, Legal Research, Document Drafting, Family Law, Legal Assistance, Mediation, Courts, Dispute

general.headline: Founding Director of Klimek & Wijay Family Lawyers
general.description:
In June 2005, Richard founded Klimek & Wijay Family Lawyers, which has since developed into a premier family law firm and one of the largest in Western Australia.  He is the firm's Managing Director and its In-House Counsel.

Richard has practised exclusively in family law and restraining order matters for the entirety of his legal career.  He is an Accredited Family Law Specialist, being one of approximately 40 lawyers presently practising in Western Australia who are recognised by the accreditation system of the Law Society of Western Australia as an expert in their discipline of law. 
 
Richard has considerable experience as an advocate and a litigator.  He has acted as counsel in over 250 trials, which is highly uncommon for any legal practitioner who practises outside of the Independent Bar.  He has been counsel in numerous trials in the Family Court of Western Australia, including highly complicated financial and parenting matters that have taken weeks requiring complex expert evidence.  He has also acted as counsel in numerous trials in the various Magistrates Courts in Western Australia for restraining order and criminal matters.
 
Richard has extensive experience in financial matters including division of property, binding financial agreements, child support agreements and spousal maintenance.  He frequently act for clients whose matters involve complex financial issues and structures such as partnerships, family trusts, discretionary trusts, unit trusts, trading companies, self-managed superannuation funds, businesses and other commercial ventures.

general.headline: Barrister at Western Australian Bar
general.description:
John Fickling is a barrister at the Western Australian Bar, specialising in taxation law and taxation law matters also involving contractual, corporations, constitutional and administrative law issues.  John appears in matters, provides taxation law advice, drafts correspondence and submissions and negotiates settlements for and against the revenue authorities.

John has practised in taxation law for 17 years, four of which were spent in London providing time-sensitive and commercially driven taxation advice to US and European global investment banks on cross-border acquisitions, financing, restructures and capital raisings.

At the Bar, working closely with solicitors, accountants and clients, John's practice includes:

* Successful and final resolution of several >$15m tax disputes through (a) negotiation without court proceedings and (b) commencing proceedings, litigation and negotiation, achieving outcomes for the taxpayers, preserving taxpayer's asset status quo in interim.

* Successful and final resolution of tax disputes including interest remission disputes and tax residency disputes.

* Successfully and final resolution of tax disputes through commencing judicial review proceedings and advancing constitutional protection arguments.

* Appearance in constitutional disputes involving trade and taxation in the High Court of Australia and the Federal Court.

* Advice on the potential application of and taxpayer defence strategies for Part IVA.

* Drafting submissions and negotiating with the ATO in respect of the issue of rulings for complex financial products and corporate restructures.

John holds a Master of Laws with first class honours, in corporate and international taxation law, and is a recipient of the Advanced Taxation Law prize from the University of Melbourne Law School. John has lectured and tutored in taxation law at the University of Melbourne and University of Western Australia and has presented at seminars in Australia, London and NY.

jobs.description:
Barrister at the Western Australian Bar, specialising in taxation law and taxation law matters also involving contractual, corporations, constitutional and administrative law issues.  Appearing in matters both for and against the Australian Taxation Office and Office of State Revenue, providing taxation law advice, drafting correspondence and submissions and negotiating settlements for and against the revenue authorities.

Ongoing and recently completed representative matters include:
* Representation of parties in tax disputes involving Australian Taxation Office ("ATO"​) including Part IVC issues (substantive taxation law) and Taxation Administration Act issues (tax debt collection legal issues)
* Representation in tax disputes involving the WA Office of State Revenue ("OSR")
* Representation in criminal prosecutions brought under the Taxation Administration Act, multiple s 19B disposal results without conviction by way of plea deal
* Representation in tax audits including working with instructors to prepare submissions and opinions for the ATO and OSR
* Legal opinions in relation to corporate tax, international tax, GST, mergers and acquisitions tax issues, corporate restructure tax issues and interaction of taxation law and constitutional law, alone and as junior counsel with Queens Counsel
* Legal advice in writing and conference on Australian and international tax structuring, including tax structuring as part of mergers and acquisitions
* Drafting of and representation for ruling applications made to the ATO, particularly in respect of financial products and corporate restructures
* Advice and Representation in respect of administrative law, contractual law, corporations law and constitutional law issues involving taxation aspects

Liability limited by a scheme approved under Professional Standards Legislation

general.description:
Elizabeth specialises in both litigious and non-litigious matters across employment law, industrial relations and occupational safety and health (OSH). Elizabeth provides general employment advice on issues including leave entitlements, terminations, disciplinary action and discrimination during recruitment.

Elizabeth's expertise includes provision of advice regarding employment related issues and risks, advising on the management of injured or unwell employees, drafting employment agreements, negotiating deeds of settlement, advising on OSH obligations, advising on industrial strategy and workplace misconduct, harassment and bullying.

Elizabeth has assisted various corporations with claims in the Fair Work Commission, the Western Australian Industrial Relations Commission, the Magistrates Court of WA, the Federal Court and the Coroner's Court for claims including unfair dismissal, adverse action, workplace fatalities and denied contractual benefits.

Elizabeth also advises clients (including national and foreign based corporations) on restructuring, redundancy, restraint of trade and termination strategies in relation to general and executive level employees in compliance with Australian law.

Colette advises on both contentious and non-contentious intellectual property matters, across all IP disciplines including patent litigation, trade mark registration and prosecution and brand protection disputes, copyright infringement disputes and food law. 

Colette has obtained experience in large scale patent litigation matters in the Federal and Full Federal Court of Australia, and advises on issues of patent validity and enforcement, particularly for pharmaceutical and life sciences clients. 

Colette also provides advice on trade mark registrability and freedom to operate, trademark portfolio management and assists with brand enforcement issues for a range of local and international clients in the FMCG, luxury goods and financial services industries.

general.headline: Resourcing Partner at Bupa Australia & New Zealand
general.description:
As a Corporate Resourcing Partner, my internal recruitment experience is predominately in financial services.  Residing in Sydney, I'm currently working for Bupa, prior to this I was employed at Westpac and  in New Zealand by AMP, ANZ Bank and TOWER.

I have demonstrated experience of effective candidate sourcing strategies and candidate management, across a wide range of jobs levels.

jobs.description:
At Bupa, we benefit from being part of a secure, international family that provides health and care services in more than 190 countries. We draw upon our local and international experience to provide Australians and New Zealanders with high quality health and care services, support and advice.

Based in Sydney, I recruit talented individuals to join our Health Insurance business in our corporate Customer Growth, Customer Service and Health & Benefits divisions.

Please visit http://www.bupa.com.au/about-us/careers to view our current opportunities across Australia.

I recruited across the BT Financial Group, with my main portfolios including Private
      
      Wealth and General Insurance.

At AMP, we're proud of the reputation we've built today, but it's tomorrow we're focused on, driven through strong leadership, increased innovation and with a wealth of career opportunities. A tomorrow built with people who want to do something today.

In my role at AMP New Zealand, I partnered with the business to deliver strategic and cost effective resourcing outcomes by sourcing, identifying and attracting the right talent to ensure that the business could execute it’s strategic goals.  

I worked on a variety of jobs across AMP New Zealand’s corporate division, identifying candidates with a customer centric talent mindset which reflected AMP’s customer service offering.

The Branch Optimisation Team, was a core project team within ANZ, working to maximize the Retail offerings branch footprint. This involved the rebranding of the National Bank branches, after moving to one set of core systems

I provided administrative support to facilitate the development and ongoing management of the Branch Optimisation Programme through effective management of calendars, flights, set up and 
ongoing organisation of meetings and reporting and contribution to governance processes.  I also provided secretarial assistance to the Head of Retail Property and the Technology Stream Lead.

During my time within the ANZ Recruitment team, it consisted of 16 FTE based
      between Auckland and Wellington.
      

    My role was to provide recruitment services within my portfolios which included Wealth
      
      & Retail. On average I handled approximately 35 - 40 roles per month.

The Recruitment team at TOWER consisted of 2 FTE's (within a HR team of 11), it handled approximately 40 - 50 active roles per month.  My main client groups were within Customer Services, Operations and IT, across the 3 business groups. I was involved in all aspects of the recruitment process, from writing advertisements, phone screening, facilitating assessment centres, interviews, employment checks to offer stage/drafting of employment agreements.

Key duties in this role included, administering the recruitment process for all support and secretarial staff.  Heavy liaison resulting from the above with department heads, recruitment agents and candidates.  Other adhoc HR duties such as coordinating starters & leavers, preparing a weekly staff HR bulletin, invoicing, overtime rosters and reporting

WENZ Recruitment was established in 2007 as a female owned and managed Recruitment Service Provider. In 2011 the business was sold due to my decision to relocate to Australia.  Today the business continues to specialise within Call Centre, Finance and Technical placements which are either temporary, contractual or on a permanent basis.  

The company is located in Cape Town, South Africa and the majority of our clientele' were leaders in their industry offering us ongoing business.  Our key strength was our ability to build ongoing and lasting relationships with both our clients and candidates. 

As the owner of the organisation I was an accredited Recruiter as confirmed by the I.P.S.C (Institute of Personnel Service Consultants), through the Training Division of APSO (Association of Personnel Service Organisations) in South Africa.   I was supported by 2 dedicated Recruitment Consultants, 1 part time Consultant and 2 Support Administrators. 

I would describe myself as a dynamic and ambitious entrepreneur who has extensive experience within the recruitment industry. I have developed a stream of networking contacts throughout my career. 

I began a very rewarding career within the Call Centre Industry where I recruited, trained and managed staff alike.  Later I joined the Recruitment Industry specialising in Call Centre (RPO), Finance, Credit and Risk Placements. 

My experience and background within these industries coupled with my people management skills have allowed me to be recognised as one of the leading Recruitment Consultants.

The Tower Group is one of the most dynamic medium sized recruitment companies. They have particular expertise in a number of specialist areas, including Credit & Risk; Call Centre; Finance; I.T; Property and Executive appointments.

My main focus upon joining the organisation was to expand their Call Centre Division which the company had recently started at the time.  This was a dual desk managing both temporary and permanent placements.

As a full cycle Recruitment Consultant, my key achievement in this role was meeting and exceeding monthly set targets, consistently achieving 40% over monthly set targets and thresholds.  Due to exceeding relationship expectations many clients offered our organisation ongoing business and so today the call centre division has proved to be extremely rewarding to the business.

Having successfully serviced over 300 major corporations nationally, during the last 45 years we have evolved into a major contributor to the South African economy.

DirectAxis is a fully integrated, and centralised direct marketing business, which links selected financial services products directly to the client. Product range/s: Unsecured Personal Loans, Car & Home Insurance, Life Assurance and Health Solutions.

As a Team Leader my core focus was managing a staff compliment of 15 - 25 call centre agents.
Facilitate / manage the day to day activities of the team, to ensure that company targets & benchmarks are met; also to ensure that the customer receives superior quality service.
Understand & relay marketing forecasts to the department Project & manage daily targets.
Performance management & counselling (disciplinary procedures).

As a Learning and Development Consultant my primary responsibility was to work in partnership with key stakeholders (internal and external) to identify training needs of the organisation.
Design, deliver and evaluate learning solutions that mitigate risk, support strategic    
direction, and enhance people capability.
Facilitate engaging and effective technical and behavioural training as scheduled.
Deliver regular, quality programmes for contact centre, operations, insurance and organisation wide.
Manage the Internal Recruitment (from initial screening to placement) for staff across the business, with a focus on liaising with agencies and hiring managers.

general.headline: Manager, On-Campus Partnerships at Bupa
general.description:
My career path has been an exciting and diverse one across multiple industries including health insurance, education and non-profit. I first started in marketing and communications, then moved into sales and recruitment focused roles. These experiences all led me to an amazing leadership opportunity with Bupa Australia, where I'm currently overseeing a national sales & service team of On-Campus Consultants.

The strongest common thread throughout my career is that I've always gravitated towards people-focused roles, building strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders wherever I go. 

A bit more about me:
 •  I don't believe in doing something halfway; rather, I throw every ounce of myself into the task at hand.
 •  I'm a sucker for storytelling, and always gravitate towards roles which focus on building relationships.
 •  I know how to laugh at myself. 
 •  I believe being genuine gets you much further than simply telling people what they want to hear.
 •  I'm determined to make an impact, be it big or small, with every client, stakeholder & colleague I meet.

Our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, happier lives, and we're achieving this through our Bupa health insurance, dental clinics, optical stores, aged care homes, therapy hubs and more.

As Manager of On-Campus Partnerships, I sit within Bupa Australia’s International & Corporate Partnerships division where my team is focused on growing our presence within the international student space. In this leadership role, I oversee our national team of On-Campus Consultants who are based on-site at University partners across VIC, NSW, SA and WA. By liasing with various internal & external stakeholders, I'm driven to ensure my team have the tools they need to continue growing our customer base while supporting international students in navigating thier health & wellness in Australia.

SMAART is an innovative, award winning recruitment agency that has been finding top talent for Australian businesses since 2005. Job seekers are naturally drawn to their relaxed, central offices, while their fully optimized website and innovative social media presence ensures a highly visible presence in the market.

While employed at SMAART, I recruited across various industries including sales, marketing, customer service, finance and office support.

Established in 1897, the YWCA is one of Metro Vancouver’s largest and most diversified non-profit organizations. It aims to foster economic independence, wellness and equal opportunities in various areas, including employment.

I was hired to create and launch a new employment program, YWCA Placement Services. Modelled after a recruitment agency in a non-profit setting, the program's goal was to provide extra support to job-seekers struggling to enter the local job-market.  My responsibilities included developing a candidate referral process for a team of over 50 employment specialists, implementing a new candidate tracking software, providing resume and interview coaching, facilitating job search workshops, promoting job-seekers into local businesses and coordinating various hiring events.

The Headhunters is one of the largest recruitment firms in Western Canada, with offices in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba. Their areas of focus include accounting & finance, operations, engineering, sales and administration. 

As a Recruitment Consultant, I performed full cycle recruitment and managed job postings, sourcing, interviewing, reference checks, contract negotiations and follow-up calls with clients & candidates. I ran a 360 permanent desk for administrative professionals, performing cold-calls, client visits and account management while meeting monthly targets.

ISLG is a Vancouver-based start-up which has created the world’s leading software for international investment law research. Its unique integrated platform enables users to examine a specific legal issue from all angles, saving them hours of research time.

I was responsible for managing all global communication with potential and current subscribers. My daily activities included organizing trial accounts, online tutorial demonstrations and vendor relations for conference & tradeshow sponsorships. Through managing existing accounts and securing new subscribers, I met and exceeded monthly sales targets of $30,000 in revenue. In addition, I directed ISLG's marketing and communication initiatives including weekly newsletters, advertising campaigns, website updates and social media outreach.

Born in 1965, SFU has become Canada's leading comprehensive university with vibrant campuses in British Columbia's largest municipalities and deep roots in partner communities throughout the province and around the world.

I was initially hired to manage the recruitment of participants for SFU’s Dig Greece Semester Abroad Program. I led marketing initiatives, screened resumes and organized interviews to select a group of 20 undergraduate participants, achieving the highest volume of applications in the history of the program.

I was then responsible for coordinating events and public relations initiatives surrounding the creation of the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Centre for Hellenic Studies at SFU, working closely with SFU’s Public Affairs and Media Relations team to inform media and the community of  the centre and its $7-million grant. I also launched new social media initiatives, photographed events and redesigned the website for Hellenic Studies at SFU.

Elettra Communications is an award-winning public relations agency based in Vancouver. They create tailored communications programs, media relations campaigns, and events that deliver real and quantifiable results.

My first project with Elettra involved coordinating the Vancouver 2010 Olympic Entertainment Program at YVR Vancouver International Airport. I was responsible for recruiting and scheduling over 60 acts for the in-terminal entertainment program which took place over two months during the Olympics.

Another project I assisted with involved performing media relations and event planning for Vancouver Magazine’s 21st Annual Vancouver Restaurant Awards. I was responsible for working closely with restaurant nominees to organize the gala’s food showcase.

HR Director |

general.description:
Brett is an internationally experienced HR Director, who has led HR strategy & organisational change in regional and multinational businesses, transformed HR delivery through adoption of digital and automated solutions (eg: Workday, ServiceNow) and won national awards for talent development programs in both the UK and Australia.  He is a seasoned generalist HR practitioner who brings an in-depth understanding of organisational change & transformation, culture management, and talent approaches to his work.

Brett’s experience includes commercially aligned HR delivery in Australia, Asia, Europe and the Middle East, and his work history includes roles at MLC, BHP Billiton, National Australia Bank, Pacific Brands, GE Finance and Bupa, most recently as Head of HR for the recently recapitalised Slater & Gordon law firm.

general.headline: Chief Financial & Strategy Officer at Bupa Australia & New Zealand
general.description:
Hisham is an experienced senior executive who is currently chief financial and strategy officer for Bupa in Australia & New Zealand. 

He was previously managing director of the Bupa Health Services business which provides clinical services in dental, optical, health coaching and medical assessment services to more than 1,500,000 customers across 260 locations through a team of 3,500 personnel.

Hisham joined Bupa as Chief Financial Officer in 2008 where he played a key role in the integration of MBF and the acquisition and establishment of a number of new subsidiary health companies.  Hisham then moved into the new role Director of Strategy and Development, where he ran these companies as an emerging business portfolio, in addition to leading the strategy, mergers, acquisitions and business development functions for Bupa in Australia and New Zealand between 2011 to June 2014.

Prior to joining Bupa Hisham, was CFO of department store, Myer. Over the past 30 years, he has held senior executive roles in a variety of industries including retail, energy, aviation and construction.

Hisham’s qualifications include a Bachelor of Economics and Master of Business Administration. He is a Fellow of CPA Australia and a Fellow of the Australian Institute of Company Directors.  

He is also a director of children’s charity, Very Special Kids, and a number of Bupa companies.

general.headline: Principal - Aged Care Gurus and Co Author of Aged Care, Who Cares?
general.description:
Rachel is the Principal of Aged Care Gurus and co-author with Noel Whittaker on “Aged Care, Who Cares?” and "The Retirement Living Handbook". 

Rachel oversees a national network of financial advisers dedicated to providing quality advice to older Australians and their families. 

Rachel has been working in financial services for 15 years and specialising in aged care for more than 10. She regularly facilitates workshops for Peak Bodies, and is highly sought after as a presenter at aged care conferences and seminars around the country. Consulted by key industry, government and media professionals for expert comment and advice, she is a regular contributor of articles on aged care planning in both specialist and consumer media. 

Rachel holds a Masters in Financial Planning which included a research report on aged care in Australia titled “Aged Care; The struggle to provide Quality, Equity, Efficiency, Sustainability and Choice”.

Rachel describes herself as passionate about aged care and believes this special sphere of interest developed from the close relationship she enjoyed with her own grandmother when she was growing up.

jobs.description:

•Provide leadership to a great team of six throughout Australia to form a tight knit unit to strengthen the growth of K Care witj our product range. 
•Provide leadership direction to the team by way of creating and implementing effective sales strategies and tools that encompasses the K Care objectives. 
•Accompany team on field visits, observations and measurements to provide constructive feedback whilst continually building the rapport with key decision makers. 
•Proactively monitor the Healthcare, Aged Care, Rehabilitation and related sectors that will enable the success of new strategies. 
•Collabritively work with the Senior Management team with budgets, forecasts, teams productivity to ensure growth in all K Care Healthcare product range. 
•Plan and implement a specific appraisal/reporting system that effectively represents the teams success that can be shared by all at K Care Healthcare.

- Develop and implement key account plans and strategies in line with marketing and
      sales management objectives.
      

    - Ensure that an effective customer contact program is implemented and managed so
      
      as to maximise sales growth & key customer relationships.

... See more

•This position was created due to the alliance of Promedica and Medical Concepts Australia in June 2009. 
•The successful Brand Developing and Marketing of the business unit throughout Australia was totally the responsibility of me for the range.
•This role was instrumental in forging the alliance relationships between the manufacturer and suppliers for a smooth transition with ongoing support. 
•Whilst on the other hand maintain and nurture customer relationships with the National Sales team was an ongoing concern due to the complexity of the product production. 
•An integral component was liaising with the production crew to maintain the customers’ expectations of quality, stock and meeting delivery schedules. 
•Another key attribute was managing and negotiating directly with suppliers, both locally and overseas to maintain expectant margins to remain competitive within the market. 
•Conducted numerous in house training sessions along with ongoing field training to provide the focus and direction of the sales team to maintain sustainability and growth in many key projects.
•Direct reports, budgeting, tender and quote submissions along with forecasting to maintain a budgeted inventory level of raw materials and finished product.
•Structuring proper channel supply from the Central Distribution Warehouse to satellite sites and third party channels.
•The Surgical business unit grew 63% over the previous two financial years. The profit margin also grew 61% in two years through component and manufacturing costs analysis. This has only been achievable by being analytical with reports and monitoring stock movements to present at management, contracted customers and supplier meetings.

•Purchased The Coffee Club franchise as a family unit in August 2007 with my son and wife. As a franchisee to an established brand we were able to increase sales from $1 million to $1.3 million over the time we were the franchisees, through marketing activity with the local community and businesses. 
•I was also responsible for successfully opening two new outlets on behalf of the Coffee Club. One was sold within six weeks of opening whilst the remaining store is now controlled by the corporate office. 
•At one stage I was managing a staff of 54 whilst maintaining budgets, stock ordering, reports, financial control, forecast planning and rosters for two stores. 
•A key to this success was attributed to effective communication by way of regular staff meetings to resolve any issues and assigning designated duties to responsible key team members. 
•Liaising regularly with our franchisee consultant to maintain corporate office expectations of the store/stores. 
•This was achieved whilst keeping within the guidelines set out as a franchisee and obtaining high results. 
•Attend and participate in various local community activities to demonstrate the commitment from our store/stores. 
•Evaluate and implement time effective plans to always achieve optimum results on a day to day basis. 
•As a franchisee last year I was requested to nominate myself as a prospective franchisee of the year due to the caliber of diligence. Attended appropriate courses and passed the food safety handlers and barista certificates with other relevant courses.

•Following an opportunity I decided to accept this role to broaden my person to person skills as the product portfolio requires supplier to patient contact with diabetes. 
•As we are one of four companies supplying Insulin Delivery Pumps in Australia and to maintain market share with growth, a great deal of innovation and strategy planning is pertinent to the companies’ success. 
•Other products within the portfolio include an Antiseptic Swab Range, handheld Doppler’s, Ambulatory Pumps and a wound care dressing product. 
•Aside from the regular requirements of this role, I have been requested to again educate our own product specialists, nursing, medical staff on the products within my own portfolio or in the surgical range. 
•On numerous occasions I have performed product presentations at conferences, education centre’s, patient homes and various medical facilities. 
•As a state team we have over achieved budget each year by 5-8% through meeting objectives and developing the profile and reputation of Medical Specialties as opposed to our other states. 
•Voluntary on call 24/7 for the Insulin Pump patients is a prerequisite to handle technical enquiries for a month at a time was my own initiative. 
•Being a participant of this has enabled me to gain problem solving skills that challenging issues are now forwarded to me. 
•Working with a range of Diabetes Educators to develop and simplify the procedure of patient initiations and education manuals has enhanced our image to potential Insulin pump patients.

•Management from Mayo Healthcare had head hunted me to assume the role of Senior Territory Manager to detail the range of Respiratory Products. 
•Having no past experience or knowledge within this market segment there was a great deal of technical knowledge to be absorbed, there fore I spent a great deal of time in units to obtain a practical understanding. 
•The range consisted of Bird, Bear and Sensomedics Ventilators, that were later branded Viasys Health. Included in the range are the associated ancillary products and the Novometrix Pulse Oximetery and End Tidal Wave monitors. 
•The role entailed market research and analysis for the range along with education to the Nursing, Interventionalists, Paramedics and all associated staff. 
•There were many challenges as the market has fierce competitors with a limited, sometimes low or budget to acquire capital equipment. 
•Budget was always met through tactical marketing towards the end of each financial year. 
•As the company expanded its product portfolio it was a requirement that I educate other team members of the technology.

•Commenced with Fairmont Medical as a Sales Specialist detailing a range of Australian manufactured disposable products as well as imported theatre capital equipment. 
•I had achieved budget and was able to turn the image in the market place of Fairmont around. 
•During this time I was presented with many tasks pertaining to the role of management, i.e., budget setting, liaison with all sales staff, setting up of bonus structures and policy issues. Hence in August of 2001, I was officially promoted to the position of National Sales Manager. 
•In this position, I had conducted five national in-house sales conferences, been responsible for establishing and maintaining international distributors as well as providing the motivation for our 7 and grew to 13 National Sales Specialists to achieve the optimum results, performance and obtaining appropriate budgets assigned to their relative or specialty area. 
•Also as part of my position it was necessary to create sales and induction manuals and liaise with the TGA to obtain appropriate certification. 
•I have also been responsible for obtaining lucrative distribution of agency products exclusively from my visits to MEDICA for and on behalf of Fairmont Medical. Attributed to this success it was decided by senior management to incorporate the National Marketing Manager responsibilities. 
•My role also involved being analytical in the presentation of reports tabled at our regular management meetings or in the field with the Sales Specialists to exhibit performance and areas of concern. 
•This position sharpened my skills, tactics and management.

jobs.description:
Founder of Aged Care Connect Pty Ltd - an aged care advisory and placement service. 

Aged Care Connect provides residential care placement services,  advice and assistance services, delivering guidance and help to families during the placement of their elderly loved one.  

Aged Care Connect has also provided group admission coordination services on a contract agreement, for a non-denominational NFP; and has consistently maintained occupancy levels across the 11 aged care homes (700 beds) above 98.5%. This has included the commissioning and admission of residents of a new aged care home. 

Aged Care Connect has also provided strategic advice to existing aged care providers, new entrants in the aged care industry and Australian fund managers about the operations of the aged care industry, both in the private and NFP sectors.

Aged Care Connect are independent and have a consumer-focused view of aged care - gained through working with many families - and are one of the most experienced aged care placement services in Australia.  

The Aged Care Connect group provided :

*   residential care placement service  , 
*   industry specific internet based directory ,  
*   senior relocation service ,   
*   strategic consultancy for Australian and overseas clients, including Hong Kong advisory firms.

As part of Bupa’s functional transformation program (FTP), Procurement is transforming from a largely reactive, tactical support function to a more strategic, proactive and value add enabler of commercial business outcomes.

A focus of the transformation is the development of key capabilities, promoting consistency in practices and methodologies, simplifying governance and promoting repeatable and reusable policies and practices.

general.headline: Chief Marketing Officer, Kohab
general.description:
CMO/Marketing Director experienced across all marketing disciplines, managing iconic brands and leading transformation across lean and large teams in a wide range of industries and markets. 

I have worked extensively across airlines, (British Airways, Air New Zealand, Qantas), travel and tourism, advertising, loyalty programmes, sport and entertainment, media services (film, TV and TVC production and post production) and Financial Services (Insurance). 

International experience includes working in the UK, Europe, Middle East, Asia, New Zealand and Australia. 

Recognised by CMO Magazine Australia in the top 50 most innovative and effective marketers in 2015 and 2017 (www.cmo.com.au/cmo50). 

Passionate about creating, evolving and managing great contemporary, sustainable and purpose led brands through a customer and mobile/digital first strategy, informed by data insights and analytics. 

Highly motivated to retain and acquire customers, improving their emotional engagement with the brand by  developing great experiences, creative content and communication work. 

Lead cross function teams and partners to improve the customers online/digital and offline customer experience at every touch point, working towards a high level of personalisation. Enjoy leveraging marketing technology to enable brand and customer growth.

Not afraid to work at pace, test and learn and iterate to optimise brand performance and ROI.

Enjoy leading change with a consultative, active listening style, developing my team to build a contemporary internal marketing culture and capability.

jobs.jobTitle: Director Of Marketing And Business Development
jobs.description:
Alongside my CMO role at Kohab, I am leading B2B marketing and business
      development for this new advisory group, based in Sydney. The Bridge iInternational is
      a non traditional consulting firm offering BPO and partnering solutions to clients to
      simultaneously improve their customer experience, reduce their cost to serve while
      
      adding value to the organisations purpose and positive impact on society.

CMO of a new digital start up which launched on Monday, 5th March 2018. Kohab.com is a digital platform and marketplace to facilitate co-ownership of property in Australia, with plans to expand globally. Kohab will build a community of people who aspire to co-live, co-invest or co-lifestyle (e.g share a holiday home), connecting them to the right property, agent, legal support, mortgage provider and insurance partners, all online. Following a number of months on their advisory board, I have moved into this exciting contracting executive role to lead there brand, marketing and customer experience strategy. More details to follow post launch.

The marketing and customer experience work on SGIO and SGIC has been recently recognised in the CMO awards for 2017 (www.cmo.com.au/cmo50)

I helped drive the brand transformation of SGIO, SGIC, IAL, and IAG’s partnership with Coles Insurance. 

IAG Satellite is a independent division of IAG based in new contemporary offices in the tech quarter of Pyrmont that has been created to support the IAG Group tackle new entrants and disruption in the general insurance market. It is a new platform to test and learn at scale, through managing the challenger brand portfolio.

jobs.jobTitle: Head of Marketing, Digital and Content
jobs.description:
Head of marketing, digital and content for the NRL, reporting to the CEO and a member of Exco. 

Over three seasons, led the marketing transformation of the NRL, increasing attendance at matches (up 10%), membership of clubs (from 200K to 300K) and developed a new digital media platform/capability to distribute content direct to the fans ($7.5m investment secured from the NRL Commission). Enhanced nrl.com. playnrl.com and internally developed a new NRL Nines digital ecosystem. Built NRL’s social media footprint, peaking at over 8.5 million unique fans for the Origin series. A key member of the team that increased digital media rights by 100%, whilst taking back control of key digital assets from Telstra.

Reporting to the CEO Qantas International. Member of Airline Loyalty Progamme leadership team.

Led the transformation of the central marketing team with a focus on improving the online and offline customer experience. Reduced marketing spend by 22% over three years with NPS increasing 22 points over the period. Relaunched the product & service proposition and Qantas Uniform ($100m project). Introduced a new global agency partner model to deliver highly creative work, recognised by the global and local industry for its effectiveness e.g. Cannes Gold Lion 2012, Olympic Committee ‘inspiration award’ 2013.

jobs.jobTitle: Executive Director and GM Media Services
jobs.description:
Reporting to the MD and responsible for group strategy, marketing and sales across Omnilab's 12 media businesses. Member of Advisory Board

I learnt about the Film and TV investment and  production/post production business in this dynamic privately owned, family company. Gave me experience of working on the agency side, leading  highly creative craft teams, enabled by digital technology. This role gave me some unique experience and expertise back on the client side in marketing.

Reporting to the Group CEO and responsible for the GCS business unit, a reseller of telecommunication products to wholesale and retail customers.

Telecorp acquired Alpha Telecom in July 2004, a start up that three of us founded in 2002. This was my first major start up experience, which I refer to as my second MBA. The first MBA was through Lancaster University, but there is nothing like the learnings from building your own business.

I joined Air New Zealand in Sydney, progressing from Regional Marketing Manager to Head of Marketing of the International Airline in Auckland to Regional Manager, Europe in Antwerp to VP Marketing In Melbourne.

It was fantastic working for an iconic, innovative brand that punched above its weight and connected so emotionally with its core customers. The culture allowed me to be highly creative in communication and customer experience development.

general.headline: Co-founder and Partner of lawyerbank
general.description:
Vanessa is a Partner and co-founder of lawyerbank. She has over 10 years commercial and transactional experience working in private practice and for the Australian Government. Vanessa has facilitated the delivery of complex and high profile projects and programs across numerous government portfolios operating under a range of different statutory and commercial frameworks.  

Vanessa currently consults to Government agencies on a variety of subject matter including complex infrastructure projects, a broad range of commercial, contractual and funding arrangements, administrative law, environmental compliance and significant goods and services procurements. 

Vanessa has undertaken secondment / consultancy work with Airservices Australia, the Australian Electoral Commission, the Australian Pesticides and Veterinary Medicines Authority,  the Department of Prime Minister and Cabinet, the Department of Social Services, the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries and Geoscience Australia.

Vanessa has comprehensive in-house experience in establishing and leading a best practice legal unit, in providing specialist legal advice and in managing and mitigating legal risk. She is very well versed in stakeholder engagement and management, contract drafting and negotiation and advising on compliance and risk management strategies

Vanessa has conducted extensive reviews of various legislative frameworks for the Australian Government, culminating in recommendations for law reform and has been involved in significant legislative developments. Vanessa is subsequently highly cognisant of the commercial, political and regulatory framework that drives the management of legal risk in the Australian Government.

Vanessa was formerly a Senior Associate at Minter Ellison Lawyers where she specialised in IP, ICT, construction and natural resource management. 

Vanessa is committed to excellence and providing high quality, practical and responsive legal advice.

jobs.description:
lawyerbank was founded by Vanessa and Alex Nicholls through their boutique firm Davis Faulkner. 

Both have both worked in top tier practice as well as on secondment in a wide range of Commonwealth agencies. 

Through this experience they recognised that:
 - there is a consistent need for secondees to assist with in-house legal teams
 - pricing of high quality more senior secondees has traditionally been expensive and often involved rigid arrangements dictated by law firms
 - law firms themselves lacked  flexible resourcing models to scale up as large projects or staff shortages dictated, particularly for shorter more intensive arrangements
 - once trained, senior lawyers were increasingly wanting more flexible working hours and more rewarding experiences

“We saw the need to develop an alternative resourcing model that works better for both the individual lawyer and the client but in a more cost effective and flexible manner. We road tested the freelancing model for several years and then lawyerbank was born. Lawyers get more flexibility and great pay and the clients get experienced and technically savvy lawyers at a much lower cost. Everybody wins.”

Visit us at www.lawyerbank.com.au

Vanessa led the legal team responsible for advising on the application of Australia's national environmental law and the Department’s most critical funding and procurement programs. Vanessa subsequently has extensive experience in contract drafting and negotiation, statutory interpretation and advising on risk management strategies.

*Strategy * Innovation & Entrepreneurship * Future of Education * Future of Work * Global Experience

I have a knack for starting, building and scaling things to their next phase.  I like to find new ways of joining the dots that bring strategic advantage to whoever I am consulting at the time. 

Mentoring is a large part of my role and I am proud of the caliber of the teams I guide, and from whom I learn from every day.

I've kick-started and grown the entrepreneur and startup support at UNSW from zero to the largest and leading program and suite of services on one Australian campus. To date the program has supported 700+ startups, developed 1,000+ founders and our top 10 teams alone have raised $17M+.

I lead and developed the successful business case that resulted in $11M+ funding from the university into the revamped Entrepreneurship department and played a large role in attracting a further $3.5M philanthropic donation into its programs

In 2014 I was trained directly under Steve Blank at UC Berekley on best-practice program design and execution for Accelerators among a small cohort of high caliber global accerator and incubator managers who remain a valuable part of my network today.

I have significant experience and know-how in Asia, with over 17 years experience with Japan including 6 years in-country and 7 doing business with China including 2 years being mentored by a pioneer of China focused student marketing and recruitment. 

I have 3 years entrepreneur experience, as Managing Director of StudyLink株式会社 where I learnt what it means to be an entrepreneur, to go through an incubator program and do business in a new market simultaneously.  The key investor in this venture, Learning Information Systems Pty Ltd was purchased by Navitas at the 3 year mark at which time I returned to Australia.

jobs.description:
I'm focused on making the Sydney Startup Hub and surrounding NSW startup ecosystem the best place to grow a startup.

The Sydney Startup Hub is the first of its kind in Australia and is unmatched in the southern hemisphere in terms of its size and density.

The Sydney Startup Hub offers more than 17,000sqm across 11 floors all under one roof in a convenient CBD location. It accommodates up to 2,500 people and welcomes thousands more in the community and events space, and the Regional Landing Pad.

Innovation Dojo was founded to connect Australia, Japan and the rest of the Asia-Pacific via innovation learning for the advancement of all involved. We provide a platform and program in addition to market research and reporting to remove barriers to entry for cross-border and cross-cultural innovation and entrepreneurship. Our customers including leading technology focused universities like Tokyo Institute of Technology, government bodies like DFAT and Austrade and individual entrepreneurs and students from Australia, Japan and beyond.

The first Innovation Dojo program, launched in 2016, aims to solve the big problems common to Japan and Australia by creating and incubating new startups with solutions ready for both countries.

Unlike most incubation programs, language skills and multi-cultural experience are a core component so the startups that are produced are both Australian made and Japan ready.

Our clients for this program include Tokyo Institute of Technology, the highest ranking science and engineering focused university in Japan and numerous individual entrepreneurs looking to build a truely global startup.

Startups supported in program include:
V-KAIWA  (VR for language learning - team formed during cohort #1 program)
Omecha (smart cushion technology - investor and business development program)
BeacoHealth (hand hygiene tech for hospitals- investor and business development program)
Baransu (health and corporate wellness tehcnology - team formed during cohort #2 program)

Sydneys not-for-profit co-working space for Asia focused start-ups. 
 
I was invited to sit on the HHQ Advisory Board with Brad Chan (CEO of Banna Property Group); Jason Yat-sen Li (Chairman of Vantage Group); Tim Fung (CEO of Airtasker); Angela Kwan (Co-founder of Catalyser); Jackie Yun (Co-founder of the Wagas Group) and Jemma Xu (Co-founder of Tripalocal).

jobs.jobTitle: Senior Manager Founder Programs & Director, FounderLab Alliance
jobs.description:
UNSW is the leading Australian university for innovation and entrepreneurship if your metrics are number of CEO's, millionaires and startups produced. In 2015, the author of the Chief Scientist report on entrepreneurship support in higher education, Colin Kinner, recognised our model as the "blueprint for startup support" for Australian universities.

Our Founders program has supported 600+ startups, helped to develop 1,000+ founders and our top 10 startups have raised $17M+. Companies we've supported include GAMURS, Premonition.io, Checkbox.ai, Chuffed, SkyCiv, Tenderfield, WipeHero, HEO Robotics, Crowd & Co and Conscious Step.

I was the first hire for the department and am proud to have an amazing team with a unique and winning approach to supporting early stage startups and small businesses.

6 years in and my work was the basis for a significant additional investment ($11M+) into the programming and capability for the university in the area of support for student and graduate entrepreneurs. 

Our services now include:
* Coach & Connect - a sounding board and concierge service to people, resources and next steps
* Entrepreneur Legal Centre - Free legal services provided by pro-bono partner law firms
* FounderLab - Professional software developer support available on a competitive application basis
* Start - Grow - Launch - Pre-accelerator program helping startups become "accelerator ready"
* Founder 10x accelerator - world class accelerator program for high performing founders
* Global Founders (China & Japan) - series of programs and services assisting global expansion
* The New Wave - building and nurturing the next generation of female entrepreneurs

We have successfully created the largest on-campus pipeline of startup founders in Australia with this model, supporting 94 startup teams between January - April in 2018 alone.

I participated as a panelist during the SBE Australia Bootcamp program and was an
      advisor for participating startups from the 2016 Springboard Enterprises Australia
      
      cohort.

Successfully completed Sake Professional Course in Tokyo, Japan demonstrating knowledge and understanding to be qualified a professional sake taster, buyer and connoisseur.The Certified Sake Professional certification is presented to applicants that have successfully passed the CSP examination, a 75-question examination designed to assess the ability to professionally work with sake in some capacity, and demonstrate competence about all things sake related. The exam covers all aspects of sake, including terminology, classifications, production and culture. The objective is to ensure that applicants can be a positive force in disseminating information about sake and in its distribution, be it importing, wholesaling, retail or on-premise. To qualify for taking the exam, applicants must complete a SEC-approved course such as the Level I Sake Professional Course.
Formerly known as the Master of Business in Technology, the AGSM MBA (Technology) program is ranked 8th in the world in the category of online MBA programs in 2016.

general.headline: Chief Operating Officer at InsideSherpa

jobs.description:
InsideSherpa is changing the world of work experience. 

We partner with leading corporate organisations to create virtual internships for students to build skills, gain experience and better understand different career paths. Our online, open access programs contain work which simulates a 'day in the life' of a graduate. 

We believe 'talent is distributed evenly, but opportunity is not'. Our programs enable corporates to open their doors to students from all backgrounds, regardless of where they are located, what they study and what university they go to; allowing them to attract, rank and hire top talent at scale.

There are now over 20,000 students on the InsideSherpa platform, and we currently run virtual internships with leading organizations including King & Wood Mallesons (commercial law), KPMG (data science), MinterEllison (commercial law), Sydney Romantics (fashion & design) and H2 Ventures (venture capital).

As a private consultant I worked on several projects for technology firms and start-ups.
      Management consulting style projects including pricing strategy, operations
      
      management, market analysis and process optimisation.

Macquarie Capital is the investment banking division of Macquarie Group, a global financial services provider. 

During my time at Macquarie, I worked on several M&A and capital markets transactions, gaining extensive experience advising clients across industries such as energy & resources, industrials, technology and agriculture.

During the latter part of my time at Macquarie, I was focused on principal investments and the management of Macquarie Capital's portfolio companies.

general.headline: Senior Administration Officer at Department of Social Services (DSS)
general.description:
Jessica was admitted to practice at the Supreme Court of the ACT in 2008 and has over six (6) years of Post-Admission Experience (PAE). 

Currently working for the Department of Social Services on the NRAS Taskforce, Jessica is keen to expand her skills and broaden her career with public service experience after many years in private enterprise.

In her most recent private practice role with Elringtons Lawyers Jessica specialised in Succession law and Estate litigation. This included preparation of documents and provision of advice in relation to wills, creation of trusts, general and enduring power of attorney and guardianship documents. Jessica has also developed specialties in inheritance disputes, and probate matters, primarily in the ACT and NSW jurisdictions. 

Jessica brings an approachable and compassionate attitude to her work generally. She prides herself in her ability to explain and step through complicated administrative and legal processes and jargons to her clients in simple language. Her ability to empathise and identify stakeholders particular needs sets her apart.

Jessica is passionate about elder law and is a strong advocate for legislative reform to prevent and address elder abuse. In addition to her work with the elderly, Jessica also volunteers for a youth harm-reduction initiative in the non-profit sector.
Jessica has been a loyal and hardworking member of the Elringtons’ team for over six years and has also pursued other interests, completing her Graduate Diploma in Teaching English as a Second Language from the University of Technology Sydney in 2011 and running ACT YMCA Youth Parliament at the ACT Legislative Assembly in 2012-13.

Jessica holds a Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Law with majors in Politics and Science, Technology and Society from University of Wollongong and a Graduate Diploma in Legal Practice from the Australian National University.

general.headline: Law Graduate @ MinterEllison
general.description:
A little bit about me...

I studied a combined degree in finance and law because I get a kick out of facing tricky problems and using quick, lateral thinking to solve them.

I got involved with VC backed start-up InsideSherpa because it's a team that genuinely wants to do incredible, innovative work in the ed-tech space.

I achieved an HD average and 1st Class Honours at uni by working damn hard when I had to and by having plenty of laughs along the way.

I ran my own tutoring and mentoring business because I'm a big believer that no problem is too complex if you break it down into small enough steps.

I love boxing, skiing, playing football and spending time outdoors because there's a heap more to life than just doing work.

jobs.description:
InsideSherpa is changing the world of work experience.

We partner with leading corporate organizations to create virtual internships for all students to build skills, gain experience and better understand different careers.

Our digital programs contain work which simulates a 'day in the life' of a graduate. Any student can enroll in our programs and build career skills on their own terms. 

We have major programs running with leading organizations including King & Wood Mallesons, MinterEllison, KPMG, Sydney Romantics and H2 Ventures and we are looking forward to announcing our next partners soon.

MinterEllison is a leading international law firm based in Australia. The firm takes an innovative and commercial approach, advising on some of Asia-Pacific's most high profile transactions, disputes and projects.

During my Summer Clerkship I worked within the firm's Competition, Financial Services and Dispute Resolution teams.

Back Schwartz Vaughan is one of Australia's leading liquor licensing law firms with over 150 years of combined licensing experience.

As a paralegal at Back Schwartz Vaughan, I prepared liquor licence applications on behalf of Woolworths' subsidiaries BWS and Dan Murphy's in New South Wales and Western Australia.

I conducted research into BOCSAR, ABS and health data in relation to alcohol consumption and liquor licensing. This research formed the basis of my honours thesis at university.

Beyond that, I did the usual stuff expected of a paralegal, such as reviewing cases, drafting submissions, letters to clients, letters to counsel and all that jazz.

I'm a strong believer that if you can't breakdown a concept and explain it in a simple and concise manner, you don't really know that much about it.

I ran my own tutoring business which grew organically as students referred me to their peers. I gained a whole range of transferable skills that I still value today. Here's a couple of the skills I picked up along the way:

Developed students’ knowledge of Ancient History, English, History Extension, Sports Science, PDHPE, Legal Studies, Accounting, Finance and Microeconomics

Provided pro bono tuition for students struggling with intellectual disability or issues at home

Maintained interaction with students, providing a high level of academic stimulation and motivation

Furthered my own academic dexterity and maintained a sound control of written and verbal skills

Gained experience at running my own business and developed an understanding of the subsequent responsibilities

Communicated effectively with a range of students from different backgrounds

Provided passion, commitment and enthusiasm to help students to excel in their studies

Everyone starts somewhere! For me, I started out custom building golf clubs by hand for everyone from kids to seasoned PGA tour professionals.

I loved seeing the smile on the faces of clients and frequently spent hours chatting with them about the sport that they're so passionate about.

general.headline: Founder | CEO at Checkbox - Digital Transformation of Regulation
general.description:
Hi there! I'm an energetic leader who is passionate about entrepreneurship, tech, and education. I also love martial arts, physics and have an obsession with the personal development of myself and others.

An entrepreneur at heart and in practice, I founded my first company, Hero Education, when I was seventeen which is still going strong today. Straight out from university, I founded Checkbox, a regtech startup which I'm currently working on full-time.
 
Checkbox is focused on helping organisations digitise and automate their expertise, processes, and documentation around regulation and compliance.

For media enquiries, speaking opportunities, or just to say hello, you can email me directly at evan@checkbox.ai

jobs.description:
Checkbox is a multi-award winning platform that enables the digital transformation of regulation. By using our drag and drop Studio, domain-experts can convert messy, unworkable processes into easy-to-use, results-driven software in the cloud, all without a developer. With simplicity and intuitive user experience at the forefront of our design, expertise is codified into self-service, interactive decision trees which produce automated documents and conclusions as an output.

If you'd like to find out more and get a live demo of Checkbox, feel free to contact me directly on +61 418 110 333.

Founded an award-winning tuition firm that has mentored 1000+ high school students with the mission to achieve scalable impact through education. With a unique business model, Hero Education has enjoyed strong growth rates year on year since inception.

Beyond academic support, Hero offers a range of pro bono programs and grants to help shape the future young leaders of tomorrow. We are about empowering and setting up our youth to create a better social and business world of the future.
